poem:
**Morning Treaty**

In the breath of dawn  
across the cold channel—  
ink dries on treaties,  
words on paper  
drift like petals,  
unfurl quietly  
in the morning sun.  
Voices of power,  
blades of grass bend  
to exchange and hope,  
while time,  
relentless,  
weaves nations  
closer.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer hails ‘once in a generation’ treaty with Germany – UK politics live 3.48pm BST Here is a video of Keir Starmer at a joint press conference with the German chancellor, Olaf Scholz. During a speech to journalists, the prime minister said the UK had agreed a treaty with Germany which he hoped would bring closer relations between the two countries. 3.25pm BST Tory leadership hopeful Robert Jenrick said he wants to put Nigel Farage’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
